title: Israelâ€™s Sin at Peor
summary: Numbers 25 tells how the Israelites fall into sin with Moabite women and worship the false god Baal of Peor. God's anger leads to a plague. Phinehas, a priest, stops the plague by zealously executing judgment.

faq.question: What sin did the Israelites commit at Peor?
faq.answer: Sexual immorality and idolatry with Moabite women and Baal worship.

faq.question: Who stopped the plague, and how?
faq.answer: Phinehas killed an Israelite man and a Moabite woman in an act of zealous justice, ending the plague.
